channel.title: Television
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: What’s on TV Sunday: Campaign Trails on ‘60 Minutes’ and ‘The Circus’
item.description: “60 Minutes” and “The Circus” parse the final days of the presidential campaign. And Nick Nolte plays a former president on the wrong side of history in “Graves.”
item.author: By KATHRYN SHATTUCK

item.title: What Would You Serve With Gin and Juice? At the Table With Martha Stewart and Snoop Dogg
item.description: On their new television show, “Snoop & Martha’s Potluck Dinner Party,” an odd couple dispense wit and kitchen wisdom.
item.author: By MATTHEW SCHNEIER

item.title: What’s on TV Saturday: Benedict Cumberbatch Hosts ‘Saturday Night Live’
item.description: Benedict Cumberbatch, in theaters as “Doctor Strange,” hosts “S.N.L.” And Alex Gibney investigates the potential for cyberwarfare in “Zero Days.”
item.author: By KATHRYN SHATTUCK

item.title: Bill Simmons’s HBO Program Is Canceled
item.description: HBO was eager to tap Mr. Simmons’s base of readers of his sports column, but that audience failed to materialize.
item.author: By JOHN KOBLIN

item.title: SundanceTV’s Identity Crisis: Indie by Night. Innocent by Day.
item.description: This channel’s new daytime block includes “All in the Family” and “The Mary Tyler Moore Show.” Good shows, but they don’t quite scream, “independent film.”
item.author: By NEIL GENZLINGER

item.title: London Has a Queen of the Night (From New Jersey)
item.description: Amy Lamé has been appointed Night Czar of London and will create a plan to develop the city’s nighttime industries.
item.author: By ROSLYN SULCAS

item.title: ‘Vanderpump Rules’ Cast Pours It On During a Bar Crawl
item.description: In a Manhattan bar crawl, the reality TV stars fixed drinks and provided a real-life diversion from a stressful world.
item.author: By KATIE ROGERS

item.title: Jennifer Grey Is Having the Time of Her Life
item.description: A night of dirty-ish dancing with the “Red Oaks” star.
item.author: By STEVEN McELROY

item.title: ‘The Crown’ Episodes 1 and 2: Stiff Lips, Warm Heart
item.description: The triumph of the first two episodes of “The Crown” is its unerring emotional focus. It finds the heart in every scene.
item.author: By TINA BROWN

item.title: Creator of ‘Bad Lip Reading’ Videos Says 2016 Election Has Defied Parody
item.description: The creator of the popular, funny YouTube videos discussed the presidential race, his sources of inspiration and life after Election Day.
item.author: By CHRISTOPHER MELE
